result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Redmond R. McKimmy

records.addlTxt:
2:56 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Redmond R McKimmy in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Redmond R McKimmy. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF136/21FO1150/21TR9501-9502. Victim rights compliance. Both parties are requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. Court adjourns. FO and TR files continue to trail 22CF136.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State by zoom.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Noonan.   Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Noonan states he is still waiting on some discovery and an offer. STC set to 09/08/22 at 9:30.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Due to an ongoing trial in branch 2, the JPTC is reset with Atty Noonan from 05/04/22 at 9:00 to 7/8/22 at 10:30
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining $305 balance on the client service fee.  kmk

Defendant, Redmond R. McKimmy, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining $350 balance on the client service fee.
Assessment of Costs for Blood Draws / Prosecution Costs - $65.00

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.   Report to WCS immediately; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Teresa G.

110PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Kevin Noonan.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
filed by Atty. Kevin Noonan  kmk
